turns.content: Which game streaming service offers the most comprehensive game library for gamers?

As an AI language model, I don't have personal preferences. However, in terms of the most comprehensive game library for gamers, it depends on what kind of games you like to play. 

As of 2021, Microsoft's Xbox Game Pass offers one of the most comprehensive game libraries for gamers. It includes several hundred games across various genres and platforms, including Xbox One, Xbox 360, and PC games. The service offers both first-party titles and third-party games, including popular titles like Minecraft, Halo, Gears of War, Doom, and more. Additionally, it includes access to day-one releases for some new games. 

Other popular game streaming services such as PlayStation Now, Google Stadia, and Amazon Luna also have a varied game library, but may not offer as many options as Xbox Game Pass.
That's interesting. I mostly play first-person shooter games. Does Xbox Game Pass have a good selection of those?

Yes, Xbox Game Pass has a good selection of first-person shooter games. Some of the most popular titles include:

- Halo: The Master Chief Collection
- Doom Eternal
- Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus
- Battlefield V
- Rainbow Six Siege
- Doom (2016)
- Metro Exodus

Additionally, Xbox Game Pass also offers a variety of other genres, so you can try out different games to see what you like. The subscription cost can vary depending on whether you choose the console or PC option, but it might be worth the investment if you are a fan of first-person shooter games.
That's awesome! I've been meaning to try out Rainbow Six Siege. I think I'll give Xbox Game Pass a go.
I'm glad I could help you. I hope you have a great time playing games on Xbox Game Pass. Don't hesitate to ask if you have any other questions!
Do I need to have an Xbox console to use Xbox Game Pass, or can I play on my PC?

No, you don't necessarily need an Xbox console to use Xbox Game Pass since it is also available on PC. If you have a PC with Windows 10 or later, you can subscribe to Xbox Game Pass for PC and access a library of games. You can download and install the Xbox app on your PC and then sign up for Xbox Game Pass from within the app. 

Once you're subscribed, you can browse the library of games and download and play them on your PC. Keep in mind that not all games in the Xbox Game Pass library are available on PC, so make sure to check if the games you want to play are available on PC before you subscribe.
That sounds great! I don't have an Xbox console, but I do have a decent PC. I'm definitely going to subscribe to Xbox Game Pass for PC and try out Rainbow Six Siege.
I'm glad I could assist you. I hope you enjoy playing Rainbow Six Siege and other games on Xbox Game Pass for PC. Have fun! If you have any other questions, feel free to ask.
